intro: Corythophora rimosa, commonly known as the rough-hair corythophora, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its branched stems and pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Corythophora rimosa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its foliage is covered in fine, rough hairs, giving it a distinctive texture.
